title_full: MIGOPS01-BP01 Your migration plan must be informed by and reflect technology, processes and business
title: Your migration plan must be informed by and reflect technology, processes and business
description: Your migration planning is the key to a successful migration to AWS, and needs to cover many aspects. These include ensuring you have the right skills at the points when they are needed and the capacity required to meet your timeline, scope, and budget. The requirements on your staff are driven by what you are migrating, so your plan has to be based on up-to-date data from your environment, obtained through a discovery exercise early on in the migration process.
outcome: A comprehensive migration plan based on current discovery data that addresses scope, technology, and processes, with clear definition of what is being migrated and appropriate use of discovery tools and migration patterns.

title_full: MIGOPS02-BP01 Define and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) which can be shared with all teams involved in the migration
title: Define and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) which can be shared with all teams involved in the migration
description: Defining and measuring KPIs helps make sure that the program remains on track to achieve the target business outcomes, and influences the behavior of stakeholders who are making the decisions throughout a migration. It helps identify when the program is trending negatively against a KPI so that remediating actions can be applied following a deep-dive review.
outcome: Established KPIs that support target business outcomes and are socialized with organizational leaders to create alignment towards goals.

title_full: MIGOPS03-BP01 Invest time and effort to ensure the required migration and operations skills are captured, skills gaps identified, and training plans are implemented and managed
title: Invest time and effort to ensure the required migration and operations skills are captured, skills gaps identified, and training plans are implemented and managed
description: Migration entails additional work for your teams. For those responsible for operating and managing the current environment, it necessitates acquiring new skills for migrating, operating, and managing applications effectively in the AWS Cloud. Training your teams not only fosters familiarity with the AWS Cloud, but also offers clarity on their roles in this new environment.
outcome: Teams with assessed skill levels, identified gaps, and implemented training plans that prepare them for migration and cloud operations.

title_full: MIGOPS04-BP01 Build a comprehensive resource model for your migration that reflects the demands of the migration as well as the regular activities
title: Build a comprehensive resource model for your migration that reflects the demands of the migration as well as the regular activities
description: Migration initiatives require involvement and input from various teams in order to be successful. It's important to understand if your teams have the bandwidth required to operate your workloads while delivering the cloud migration in parallel.
outcome: A comprehensive resource model that accounts for migration workstreams, roles, team composition, and existing team utilization, with appropriate augmentation from partners or AWS services where needed.

title_full: MIGOPS05-BP01 Build a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) team within your organization as part of your migration planning
title: Build a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) team within your organization as part of your migration planning
description: A Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) is a multi-disciplinary team that is assembled to implement the governance, best practices, training, and architecture needed for cloud adoption in a manner that provides repeatable patterns for the larger enterprise to follow.
outcome: An established CCoE team responsible for cloud operations, implementing governance, best practices, and architecture patterns for cloud adoption.

title_full: MIGOPS06-BP01 Define Cloud Operations Strategy: understand your current operating model, processes and tools, and explore how to implement them efficiently, securely and reliably in the cloud to create your cloud operations strategy
title: Define Cloud Operations Strategy: understand your current operating model, processes and tools, and explore how to implement them efficiently, securely and reliably in the cloud
description: Define a comprehensive Cloud Operations Strategy, covering resource allocation, security, cost management, and governance to streamline the migration process effectively.
outcome: A defined cloud operations strategy that transforms the operating model from on-premises to cloud, including operations, security and control, platform architecture, and infrastructure provisioning.

title_full: MIGOPS06-BP02 Align AWS operational requirements with your existing tools and identify any gaps
title: Align AWS operational requirements with your existing tools and identify any gaps
description: Align your existing operational tools with AWS requirements to ensure they can support workloads in the cloud environment.
outcome: Existing operational tools aligned with AWS requirements with identified gaps addressed.

title_full: MIGOPS06-BP03 Regularly test your operations in the cloud
title: Regularly test your operations in the cloud
description: Regularly test your cloud operations to ensure they work as expected and teams are prepared.
outcome: Regular testing of cloud operations validates operational readiness and team preparedness.

title_full: MIGOPS07-BP01 Calculate your potential migration velocity using both technical and non-technical perspectives (like network bandwidth, team availability, volume of changes, and change freezes)
title: Calculate your potential migration velocity using both technical and non-technical perspectives
description: Understanding migration velocity helps determine the number of servers that can be migrated in a wave, the duration required, and the availability of human and technical resources.
outcome: Calculated migration velocity considering technical factors (network bandwidth, replication speed) and non-technical factors (team availability, change windows, testing requirements).

title_full: MIGOPS08-BP01 Ensure you have a testing strategy in place
title: Ensure you have a testing strategy in place
description: Every application migration has a testing phase. You have to plan how the tests are done, what to test, and what are the test criteria. Use a risk-based, points of change testing strategy focusing on network changes, new controls, and operational integration.
outcome: A comprehensive testing strategy focused on points of change, including network latency testing, application performance validation, and operational readiness verification.

title_full: MIGOPS09-BP01 Determine if your current CI/CD pipeline works on AWS
title: Determine if your current CI/CD pipeline works on AWS
description: CI/CD pipelines or software development lifecycles (SDLC) can vary in complexity between applications and businesses. When migrating these applications to AWS, take these processes into consideration, as it requires multiple stages to migrate both the running application and the associated deployment pipelines.
outcome: Assessment of existing CI/CD pipeline tools and their capabilities to work with AWS services, with migration plan for updates or tool selection.

title_full: MIGOPS09-BP02 Provision resources through infrastructure as code (IaC) templates
title: Provision resources through infrastructure as code (IaC) templates
description: It is recommended that all resources required for each application are provisioned through IaC templates. This approach keeps configuration with the application code so it can be managed centrally.
outcome: Infrastructure components and configuration provisioned through IaC templates (CloudFormation or other tools), with configuration managed centrally with application code.
